p: The CME content was measured according to Jahanshiri et al. [ 7 ]. Candida albicans (10 6 cells/ml) was inoculated onto Sabouraud dextrose broth medium with C. carvi EO (160 μg/ml) and fluconazole (2 μg/ml) and then incubated at 35ºC for 72 h. The fungal cells were harvested by centrifugation at 5,000 rpm for 5 min, washed with distilled water, dried at room temperature, and weighed. In the next stage, 3 mL of 25% alcoholic potassium hydroxide was added to each pellet and vortexed for 1 min.
